qas.question: What epidemic did the FAA have to handle in the 1960s?
Who now takes responsibility for aviation security?
When did the FAA become more involved with the environmental aspects of aviation?
When was legislation passed that gave the agency management of a new airport aide program?
What is the altitude which the FAA regulates over?
When did the FAA start to regulate low altitude kite and balloon flying?
What epidemic in the 60's cause aviation security to be taken over by Homeland?
Whne did Homeland become more involved with the environmental aspects of aviation?
When did the Faa receive the power to set watercraft noise standards?

context: The FAA gradually assumed additional functions. The <a0_0><b6_0>hijacking<a0_0/> epidemic<b6_0/> of the 1960s had already brought the agency into the field of civil aviation security. In response to the hijackings on September 11, 2001, this responsibility is now primarily taken by the <a1_0>Department of Homeland Security<a1_0/>. The FAA became more involved with the environmental aspects of aviation in <a2_0><b7_0><b8_0>1968<b8_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/> when it received the power to set aircraft noise standards. Legislation in <a3_0>1970<a3_0/> gave the agency management of a new airport aid program and certain added responsibilities for airport safety. During the <b5_0>1960s and 1970s,<b5_0/> the FAA also started to regulate high altitude (over <a4_0>500 feet<a4_0/>) kite and balloon flying.
